page.title: 08Transport and Employment
page.content: Over 80% of the households living in Thurleigh have a car and a high proportion have more than one car. There is a good bus service to Bedford, which calls at the village 6 times a day on weekdays and 4 times a day on Saturdays. The buses provide a good journey to work service, but there is no public transport to enable people to use the entertainment facilities offered in the town in the evenings. A good deal of the population travel to Bedford to work, but there are still a few locally based jobs. The Building and Funeral business that has been in the village for 350 years employs two village people. Some are employed at a local transport company and a few still work on the land. The largest employer locally is the R.A.E. an experimental and aircraft establishment.
